cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 100 mi ESE of Wilmington, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly edging WNW, then WSW, with the center expected to move onshore along the southern North Carolina / northern South Carolina coast before crawling inland across South Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Cape Fear, NC to Myrtle Beach, SC corridor

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC (Tropical Storm Watch) and Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC (Hurricane Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: South Santee River SC to Duck NC including Albemarle & Pamlico Sounds (Hurricane Warning); Storm-surge warning from South Santee River SC to Duck NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coastal North Carolina through northeastern South Carolina; secondary impacts farther south into Georgia and northeastern Florida mainly from swell and peripheral rain bands
weather_observation.wind: Occasional outer-band gusts to 25–30 mph possible Friday-Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor water-level rises (generally <1 ft) and dangerous surf/rip currents along northeast Florida beaches
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of intermittent rain from outer rainbands late Friday into Saturday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and high surf may disrupt vessel movements and cargo handling over the weekend
